instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3437 no PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message:
Hello,
i am working on a 820-3437 that is not turning on. Some S3 Rails are missing. I followed this path and the enables and PM_LSP_S4_L are missing. On two sections of the board (U7501 and R5151) i could find some minor sights of corrosion but no damaged Parts/traces there. I attached a picture of U7501. Bios resistors and traces look fine too. Now i am stuck. 
Thank you for any help!

threads.title: 820-3437 no PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message: 5V coming on at L7520? If that does not come on it will be power cycling and nothing else will work. Seems like U7501 could be dead or corroded trace/resistor there.

threads.title: 820-3437 no PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message: L7520 has 0.0V on it but no short there. Can there be 5V if P5VS4RS3_EN and PM_SLP_S4_L are not there?. I exchanged U7501 to be sure it is fine and there are no corroded traces. But still no change. On the other side of U7501 PP3V3_S5 is created (3.3V on L7560) so i assume that U7501 is working fine.

threads.title: 820-3437 no PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message: PPVRTC is there. U1900, U1950 and the surrounding areas look fine. i took a close look of the complete board but nothing else is looking bad except for one Ground probe point that was a little corroded... Should i put it in the ultrasonic if i can´t find any visual damage?

threads.title: 820-3437 no PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message: Sure why not. You did check for power cycling, hard to catch on a multimeter, impossible on an autorange one. Best to use a scope.

threads.title: 820-3437 no PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message: the cleaning also did not help. Any other Ideas what can cause this?

threads.title: 820-3437 no PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message: Make a picture of what U7501 looks like now. Did you check for pulsing on all rails, preferably with a scope. Checked all rails for short to GND?

threads.title: 820-3437 no PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message:
No Title

PPBUS_G3H, PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS, PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS, PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL, PPDCIN_G3H, PP3V42_G3H, PPVRTC_G3H, PP5V_S5, PP5V_S5, are all there and stable. Other rails are missing because PM_SLP_S4_L is missing.

threads.title: 820-3437 no PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message: If anything is wrong it will be power cycling. You cannot just say SLP_S4 is missing without checking for power cycling. Hard to catch on many multimeters, impossible on auto ranging ones.

threads.title: 820-3437 no PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message: I´ll see if i can get a scope soon. Anything special to look for when buying one?

threads.title: 820-3437 no PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message: Nah, you can do this with an old free bee CRT thing...

threads.title: 820-3437 no PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message: I got a scope now and checked all present rails for pulsing but i couldn´t find any unsteady rails. So can i say that it is not power cycling or did i do it wrong? But still no 5V on L7520...  I´m really confused when PM_SLP_S4_L is missing...

threads.title: 820-3437 no PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message: The rail to check for power cycling would be the 5V rail.

threads.title: 820-3437 no PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message: PP5V_S4_RS3 is straight 0V. No pulsing or anything noticeable on the scope.

threads.title: 820-3437 no PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message: Check R1300-R1303 all 4 resistors should have about 3V on both pins, also check voltage on R7202 both pins...

threads.title: 820-3437 no PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message: all resistors measure fine and there are 3-3.3V on all pins (R7202 = 8.58V) so i assume everything is fine there

threads.title: 820-3437 no PM_SLP_S4_L
threads.message: It could be that the 3V or 5V spiked when water hit U7501. Measure resistance to GND on both rails and compare to a good board. Otherwise I am out of ideas besides crap under the SMC.
